alert.note: Alert for Defiance; Paulding; Williams (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 29 at 3:02AM EDT until July 29 at 3:30AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN STEUBEN...NORTHEASTERN ALLEN...EASTERN DE KALB... DEFIANCE...NORTHERN PAULDING AND WILLIAMS COUNTIES... At 302 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Holiday City to near Paulding, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Defiance, Bryan, Montpelier, Hicksville, Butler, Paulding, Edgerton, Antwerp, West Unity, Woodburn, Stryker, Edon, St. Joe, Holiday City, Edgerton In Williams County, Columbia, West Jefferson, Pulaski, Farmer, and Newville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Indiana near mile marker 156. Interstate 80 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 22. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
